pageContext.description: This is the only cored palstave I have yet sketched in which the the [sic] hole through the centre has been drilled. I suggest the septum has been "cored out" in some unusual way - which may make the drilling a necessity. I do not think the palstave would "leave" the mould had the hole been cast.
pageContext.other: On diagram says "The shoulder is not exaggerated. See  note" & "No. 98; E.C Middleton, Hardwick Rd, Streetly 23.12.21"
pageContext.collection: J.G. Barnett Esq., Rednal, Bromsgrove,Acquired from Ireland 1921
pageContext.remarks: "Bronze Age Palstave 55 Co Cork" inscribed on label
